examine or analyse system activity

attempted violations of access control mechanisms

the requirements to control the user access to correspondences, files, and records and various functionalities provided

values same as previous item
values derived from context, e.g.date, file reference, user identifier
Frequently-executed System transactions must be designed so that they can be completed with a small number of interactions
Customisation should include, but need not be limited to the following changes: menu contents; layout of screens; use of function keys; on-screen colours, fonts and font sizes

shall be the standard for guidance on ICT accessibility
Software accessibility ISO 9241-171
its requirements and recommendations

Navigation should be designed to help users understand where they are, where they have been and where they can go next
where they are
Shared Phenomena: where he or she is in the navigation structure and of the current segment position with respect to the overall structure

System Requirements: Alternative access paths for navigating to a specific unit of content should be offered to support different navigation strategies.
minimizing navigation effort
Splash screens should be avoided unless they provide useful content or feedback about the application state to the user.
Avoiding opening unnecessary windows
usability and accessibility
Shared Phenomena: cognitively more difficult to understand the navigation structure

System Requirements: Horizontal scrolling should be avoided wherever possible
choose between different input devices for activating controls
device independence
be as robust as possible in the face of changing technology
acceptable opening times
acceptable download times
for frequently accessed pages or pages that are important for user navigation and exploration
Minimizing user errors
The content of error messages shown on the pages or special error pages should clearly state the reason why the error occurred and, if possible, actions the user can take to resolve the error.
error messages to be in the same language as the user interface

When designing user interfaces for use by diverse groups, input and output of information elements such as currency, units of measurement, temperatures, date and time, phone numbers, address or postal codes should be designed so that they are usable.
Text should be able to be resized by the user

The reading and understanding of the textual content on the screen should be supported by suitable means, including the use of short sentences, the division of the text into shorter chunks or the presentation of content items in the form of bullet points.
Fast skimming of text should be supported
Text presented on the pages should be readable taking into account the expected display characteristics and spatial arrangement
Within-page links should be clearly distinguishable from other links that lead to a different page
Avoiding link overload
Shared Phenomena: Text pages containing large proportions of links

Software System: The target or purpose of a link
System Requirements: directly indicated by its label

avoiding generic labels such as “go” or “click here” except where the purpose of the link is clear from its context on the page or the labels have commonly understood semantics in the particular application domain
Links that open new browser windows or pop-up windows should be clearly marked
Distinguishing navigation links from controls

Shared Phenomena: sorting a list of search results

System Requirements: the expected layout
paper format
orientation
Use of “white space”
space filled only with the background color should be used in such a way that it does not impair the visual skimming of the page.
The length of a page should be selected so as to support the primary purpose and use of the page.
Short pages are generally more appropriate for homepages, navigation pages, or overview pages that need to be read quickly.
taking into account human capabilities and restrictions in perceiving colour
not as the only means of conveying information
coding
Using frames with care
When frames are used, it is important to title each frame, and to describe its purpose and how frames relate to one another other.
Providing alternatives to frame-based presentation

System Requirements: Page titles should be placed in a consistent location on the different pages
the general principles of human perception

The number of incidents of unplanned downtime
provide adequate response times for commonly performed functions under both standard and peak conditions
must be able to perform a simple search within 5-8 seconds and a advanced search (multiple search criteria) within 10-15 seconds regardless of the storage capacity or number of cases
retrieve and display within 5-8 seconds the case which has been accessed within the previous 2 months, regardless of storage capacity or number of cases in the CCTNS system
rapid retrieval of frequently-used cases
must be able to retrieve and display within 20 seconds the case which has not been accessed within the previous 2 months, regardless of storage capacity or number of cases in the CCTNS system
facilitate ease of maintenance and leverage advancement in open standards and web technologies

support multilingual interface
work even in an offline mode with the critical functionality
